definition: Zhang Heng (78-139) great Han dynasty astronomer and mathematician
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to weigh/weight/measure

sentences.english: The seismometer was invented by Zhang Heng.
sentences.chinese: 地震儀是由張衡發明的。

sentences.english: Was it in 132 AD, when the Chinese scientist Zhang Hêng invented the seismocope?
sentences.chinese: 是公元132年中國科學家張衡發明地動儀的時候嗎？

sentences.english: China's Zhang Heng invented the seismograph during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中國的張衡在漢朝時發明了地動儀。

sentences.english: The name of a seismograph invented by the ancient Chinese scientist, Zhang Heng.
sentences.chinese: 中國的張衡在漢朝時發明了地動儀。

sentences.english: Chapter one the expression of the new change of the creation.
sentences.chinese: 第一章張衡創作新變表現。

sentences.english: Heng invented the seismograph during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 地震儀是由張衡發明的。

sentences.english: Zhang Heng is a man of ancient time.
sentences.chinese: 張衡是古時候的一個人。

sentences.english: The inventor was Zhang Heng, a famous scientist in the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220 AD).
sentences.chinese: 這架地動儀的發明者是中國東漢時著名的科學家張衡。

sentences.english: The inventor was Zhang Heng, a famous scientist in the Eastern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 發明者是東漢著名的科學家張衡。

sentences.english: Zhang heng just walked into the house inside.

definition: to broadcast a time signal

variant of 曆法|历法 calendar

Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC

Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
Former Han dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 西漢|西汉[Xi1 Han4], Western Han dynasty
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
